I don't think Canada really needs to worry. WE just announced sanctions against syria, and the EU is signing a trade agreement witht hem. CAnada is one of our biggest trading partners, and we run a pretty good sized trade deficit with them. This is one of the problems with running a "Service based economy", if you don't make stuff yourself, you have to import it from somewhere.
 
 O'Reilly also claimed that France had lost billions of dollars becasue of our boycott of France. This is pretty hard to believe, since we only do about 1.2 billion in trading with the french anyway.  )

 
 Worse. Our government polishes economic numbers for the purpose of political enhancement, not assessment of conditions with a goal of improvement. A couple of popular numbers for US Public consumption are unemployed and new jobs created. This is accomplished by each state reporting the following:
 
 1. number of persons collecting unemployment benefits
 
 2. number of new jobs (people taking new positions must be reported by employers to the state within 20 days, this is sponsored by what's called the federal deadbeat dad law, used to enforce child support payments) 
 
 Not included in the published calculations 
 
 1, What happens to the people who exhaust unemployment benefits, effectively reducing published unemployment numbers. Found employment? Welfare? Federal unemployment benefit extensions have been used since 9/11 to provide a financial cushion for the unemployed. This month our administration dominated congress voted to eliminate the extensions, which will show a reduction of the unemployed number for political purposes. 
 
 2. Types of new jobs, downgrades from industrial to service level, number of unemployed finding new jobs and being true reductions in the unemployed number, new jobs created by increased manufacturing (only rose .08% in a period where job growth was 2.9%) or percentage between public sector (rapidly expanding) and private sector jobs. 
 
 The primary purposes of US Government economic reporting is to sooth the public for political purposes and assure those foreign investors in our treasury issues (45%) that our economy is improving and our enormous deficits in no way threaten our financial well-being. If one is a government or stock brokerage house economist, your financial model will tend to vary from reality.

lord tammerlain

Overall in a trade war between Canada and the US where all products and services stopped crossing the border Canada would win. Both would be hurt in such a trade war, but while Canada would suffer financial hardships from the lack of trade the US would miss the oil, natural gas and electricity imports from Canada that account for about 30% of the US energy needs
